All About Us:At TransLoc, our mission is to reimagine how people move through universally accessible, equitable, and sustainable mobility. We believe that public transit is central to this mission and the future of mobility as we know it. Our intelligent transportation software portfolio includes flexible demand response, fixed route systems, and planning services, providing software and services for more than 1500 transit providers worldwide. Our fixed route and on-demand systems have powered more than 600 million annual rides, helping transit users reach jobs, schools, healthcare and other important destinations in an equitable and accessible way. At TransLoc, we strive to put people first, play to win, do the right thing (even when it’s not easy), rise up to the challenge, and possess a growth mindset. We are looking for talented individuals to join our collaborative team, people who want to have a voice and impact on what the future holds. If that’s you, please consider applying.We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Head of ProductJob Summary At TransLoc, the Head of Product leads the vision, execution, and organization of product managers and product designers within the product suite. In coordination with the Head of Engineering, the Head of Product will work to develop a long-term strategy and vision for the hardware, software, and data analytic services of the product suite in alignment with the company's strategy and vision. The Head of Product will champion change, and this role will require a leader that will create a results-oriented, innovative, best-in-class product organization.You will be great for this role if you:Have a passion for the development of team membersHave a heart for our customers and experience driving resultsCore Responsibilities Create, define, and articulate compelling product vision and strategy for current and future productsFunction as a key leader and executer in the determination of key feature and functionality determination and prioritizationAnalyze needs of customers & market, key stakeholders, and competitive opportunity to inform the product vision and strategy while maintaining ownership of the life cycle of the productManage and mentor a team of product managers and designers to promote professional development and high performance.Partner with the engineering department to ensure efficient and effective delivery of products to the marketHelm team collaboration across geographically dispersed teamsCollaborate with senior leadership to align product strategy with company vision and objectives.Provide necessary input from product in terms of OPEX and revenue workEstablish and nurture business relationships with decision-makers in transit; ensure our customers understand our roadmap and are aligned with product visionWhat you bring to the role: industry Work EnvironmentTransLoc is a hybrid-remote workplace combining in-office and remote work to varying degrees based on the role requirementsThis role will require up to 25% travelWhat We Have to Offer:TransLoc provides medical, dental, and vision coverage options for you and your family in addition to life insurance and short-term and long-term disability coverage.Financial perks include a 401(k) with discretionary match program, a referral bonus program, computer purchase plan, discounts for home/auto insurance, and more. We also have a Pick Your Perk program that adds a stipend to each paycheck - no strings attached, no receipts required. This one is all about contributing to happiness and work/life balance.Speaking of work/life balance, we provide unlimited PTO and a flexible working hours policy. Our organization is primarily remote, but if you are local to Durham, NC, you can work from the office, too. (Some restrictions apply depending on role). You will also have access to our counseling and wellness Employee Assistance Program 24/7. Our goal at TransLoc is to make sure our people are successful - we have put initiatives in place to encourage growth and have a Professional Development program in place that includes 100% tuition fees and book reimbursement (some restrictions apply).
